revised_title: Vibrationally Mediated Photodissociation and Intramolecular Motion in HOOH and HOOD
tldr: The authors studied the intramolecular motion in HOOH and HOOD molecules using photofragment mapping after populating specific rovibrational levels with a tunable, pulsed laser. They obtained quantum state distributions, vector correlations, and vibrational and rotational fragment pair correlations using polarized, Doppler-resolved laser-induced fluorescence techniques. The results provide insights into the energy redistribution within the molecules and highlight the role of rotation in promoting rotation-vibration coupling.
